revision.text:
{{Infobox football biography |name = Ovie Ejaria |image = Ovie Ejaria 2018.jpg | fullname = Oviemuno Dominic Ejaria{{cite web|title=FIC|url=http://frenzinternationalcup.com/2015/wp-content/uploads/2015/01/M1-FUIvsLIV.pdf|publisher=Frenz International Cup|format=PDF|page=1|accessdate=3 October 2015}} |image_size = |caption = Ejaria with Rangers in 2018 |birth_date = {{birth date and age|1997|11|18|df=y}}{{cite web | title = Ovie Ejaria. | url = http://www.11v11.com/players/ovie-ejaria-253818/ | publisher = 11v11 | accessdate =16 April 2016}} |birth_place = [[London Borough of Southwark|Southwark]], England |height = 1.83m{{cite web|title=O. Ejaria|url=https://int.soccerway.com/players/oviemuno-ejaria/376871/|website=Soccerway|accessdate=3 February 2018}} |position = [[Midfielder]] |currentclub = [[Reading F.C.|Reading]]
(on loan from [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]]) |clubnumber = 18 |youthyears1 = 2005–2014 |youthclubs1 = [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] |youthyears2 = 2014–2016 |youthclubs2 = [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] |years1 = 2016– |clubs1 = [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] |caps1 = 2 |goals1 = 0 |years2 = 2018 |clubs2 = → [[Sunderland A.F.C.|Sunderland]] (loan) |caps2 = 11 |goals2 = 1 |years3 = 2018 |clubs3 = → [[Rangers F.C.|Rangers]] (loan) |caps3 = 14 |goals3 = 1 |years4 = 2019– |clubs4 = → [[Reading F.C.|Reading]] (loan) |caps4 = 6|goals4 = 1 |nationalyears1 = 2016–2017 |nationalteam1 = [[England national under-20 football team|England U20]] |nationalcaps1 = 7 |nationalgoals1 = 2 |nationalyears2 = 2018– |nationalteam2 = [[England national under-21 football team|England U21]] |nationalcaps2 = 1 |nationalgoals2 = 0 |club-update = 00:13, 25 February 2019 (UTC) |ntupdate = 16:47, 24 March 2018 (UTC) }} '''Oviemuno Dominic Ejaria''' (born 18 November 1997) is an English professional [[association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[midfielder]] for [[Reading F.C.|Reading]] on loan from [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]].https://www.skysports.com/amp/football/news/11669/11601086/liverpool-midfielder-ovie-ejaria-to-join-reading-on-loan He is a current [[England national under-21 football team|England U21]] international. ==Club career== ===Liverpool=== Born in London to Nigerian parents, Ejaria grew up supporting [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] for whom he played for nine years before signing for [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] in summer 2014. His first senior appearance was in a pre-season [[Exhibition game#Association football|friendly]] prior to the [[2016-17 Premier League|2016-17 season]] against [[Tranmere Rovers F.C.|Tranmere Rovers]] on 8 July 2016.{{cite web|last=Williams|first=Sam|title= Ings winner decides Tranmere friendly|url=http://www.liverpoolfc.com/news/first-team/226938-match-report-ings-winner-decides-tranmere-friendly|publisher=Liverpool F.C.|accessdate=26 October 2016|date=8 July 2016}} Despite being relatively unknown prior to the game he performed exceptionally well and caught the eye of first team manager [[Jürgen Klopp]] who selected him for four more friendlies over the summer.{{citation needed|date=November 2016}} His first competitive call-up came on 16 September in a [[Premier League]] match against [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]]. He was an unused substitute in Liverpool's 2–1 victory.{{cite web|last=McNulty|first=Phil|title=Chelsea 2-1 Liverpool |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/37314772|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=26 October 2016|date=16 September 2016}} Four days later, he made his first team debut against [[Derby County F.C.|Derby County]] in the [[EFL Cup|League Cup]] replacing [[Roberto Firmino]] in the 3–0 victory.{{cite web|title=Derby County 0-3 Liverpool |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/37346111|author=|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=26 October 2016|date=20 September 2016}} On 25 October, Ejaria made his full debut in the fourth round of the EFL Cup in a 2–1 win over against [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham]] at [[Anfield]].{{cite web|title=Liverpool 2-1 Tottenham |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/37686653|author=Luke Reddy|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=26 October 2016|date=25 October 2016}} On 6 November 2016, he debuted in the Premier League, coming on as a [[Substitute (association football)|substitute]] in Liverpool's 6–1 home win over [[Watford F.C.|Watford]].{{cite web|first=Patrick|last=Jennings|title=Liverpool 6-1 Watford|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/37814248|publisher=BBC Sport|date=6 November 2016|accessdate=7 November 2016}} ====Loan to Sunderland==== On 31 January 2018, Ejaria made a deadline day switch to [[Sunderland A.F.C.|Sunderland]], signing on loan for the remainder of the season.{{Cite web | title = Ovie Ejaria, Ashley Fletcher and Lee Camp join Sunderland | publisher = BBC Sport | date = 1 February 2018 | accessdate = 1 February 2018 | url = https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42896591}} He made 11 appearances in total as the club were relegated to [[EFL League One|League One]].{{cite news|url=https://www.thisisanfield.com/2018/06/steven-gerrard-set-to-make-his-first-signing-from-liverpool/|title=Steven Gerrard set to make his first signing from Liverpool|publisher=Liverpool Echo|last=Matchett|first=Karl|date=3 June 2018|accessdate=3 June 2018}} His only goal, and his first in senior football, came in the final match of the regular season when he opened the scoring in a 3–0 win over the eventual league champions, [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolves]].{{cite news|url=http://www.espnfc.com.ng/report?gameId=483159|title=Relegated Sunderland end season with emphatic victory over champions Wolves|publisher=ESPN|date=6 May 2018|accessdate=7 June 2018}} ====Loan to Rangers==== In June 2018, Ejaria moved on loan to [[Scottish Premiership]] club [[Rangers F.C.|Rangers]], managed by former Liverpool captain and academy coach [[Steven Gerrard]], after signing a new long-term contract with Liverpool.{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44399483 |title=Rangers sign Liverpool midfielder Ovie Ejaria on a season-long loan |work=BBC Sport |publisher=BBC |date=7 June 2018 |accessdate=7 June 2018}}{{cite web|url=https://www.liverpoolfc.com/news/first-team/304170-ovie-ejaria-liverpool-fc-deal-loan-rangers|title=Ejaria signs new LFC deal, joins Rangers on loan|publisher=Liverpool F.C.|last=Lynch|first=David|date=7 June 2018|accessdate=13 July 2018}} He made his debut on 12 July, coming on as a second-half substitute in Rangers' 2–0 [[UEFA Europa League]] win over Macedonian side [[FK Shkupi|Shkupi]].{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/live/football/44769909|title=Europa League: Hibs hit six, Rangers win in Gerrard's first game|publisher=BBC Sport|last1=Palmer|first1=Bryn|last2=Southwick|first2=Andrew|date=12 July 2018|accessdate=13 July 2018}} He scored his first goal for the club in a [[Scottish Premiership]] match against Motherwell on 26 August.{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45237301|title=Motherwell 3-3 Rangers|publisher=BBC Sport|date=26 August 2018|accessdate=28 August 2018}} In December 2018 his loan was curtailed earlier than planned and he returned to training with Liverpool.https://www.liverpoolfc.com/news/first-team/330371-ovie-ejaria-liverpool-rangers ====Loan to Reading==== A loan move to [[Reading F.C.|Reading]] was announced on January 7, 2019.https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/46788125 ==International career== Ejaria is eligible to represent [[England]] or [[Nigeria]] internationally. He trained with the [[Nigeria national under-17 football team|Nigeria Under-17]]s team in 2013 and stated that his international allegiance lay with the country in 2014.{{cite news|last1=Prentice|first1=David|title=Liverpool starlet Ovie Ejaria set for international call up before making a first team appearance|url=http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/liverpool-starlet-ovie-ejaria-set-11681482|accessdate=6 November 2016|work=Liverpool Echo|date=29 July 2016}} However, despite rumours of a senior Nigeria call up being in the offing, Ejaria accepted a call up to the [[England national under-20 football team|England U20]] team on 30 September 2016.{{cite web|last1=Lusby|first1=Jack|title=Ovie Ejaria called up to England U20 squad, despite previous Nigeria allegiance|url=http://www.thisisanfield.com/2016/09/ovie-ejaria-called-england-u20-squad-despite-previous-nigeria-allegiance/|website=This is Anfield|accessdate=6 November 2016|date=30 September 2016}} He made his debut for the Under-20 team on 7 October, in a 3–1 win against Germany, playing the whole match.{{cite web|title=Calvert-Lewin and Lookman fire Lions to win over Germany|url=http://www.thefa.com/news/2016/oct/07/u20s-germany-report-071016|website=The FA|accessdate=6 November 2016|date=7 October 2016}} Ejaria was selected for the [[England national under-20 football team|England under-20 team]] in the [[2017 FIFA U-20 World Cup]]. He made his first start in a game in the first round match against South Korea,{{cite web |url=http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/liverpool-pair-ovie-ejaria-sheyi-13097937 |title=Liverpool pair Ovie Ejaria and Sheyi Ojo help England continue their World Cup dream |first=Neil|last= Jones|date= 26 May 2017 |work=Liverpool Echo}} and came on as a substitute the quarter-final against Mexico,{{cite web |url=http://www.liverpoolfc.com/news/first-team/265542-ejaria-features-as-england-u20s-reach-world-cup-semi-final |title=Ejaria features as England U20s reach World Cup semi-final|first=Steve|last= Hunter|date= 5 June 2017|work=Liverpool FC }} but was an unused substitute in the final where England beat Venezuela 1–0.{{cite news |url = https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40237981 |title= Under-20 World Cup: England beat Venezuela in final |work=BBC Sport |date= 11 June 2017 }} He was called up for the [[England national under-21 football team|England under-21 team]] in March 2018, making his debut in a friendly against Romania.{{cite news |url = http://www.skysports.com/football/news/16261/11303332/jake-clarke-salter-ovie-ejaria-ademola-lookman-young-lions-impress-in-england-u21s-victory|title= Jake Clarke-Salter, Ovie Ejaria, Ademola Lookman: Young Lions impress in England U21s victory |work=Sky Sports |date= 24 March 2018}} He was called up again in May 2018 for the [[Toulon Tournament]]{{cite news |url = https://www.liverpoolfc.com/news/first-team/302380-ovie-ejaria-england-u21-toulon |title=Ejaria named in England U21s' Toulon Tournament squad |work=Liverpool FC |date= 18 May 2018}} but had to withdraw from the squad due to an injury.{{cite news |url = https://www.liverpoolfc.com/news/first-team/303257-liverpool-fc-ovie-ejaria-england-u21s |title= Ejaria withdraws from England U21 squad |work=Liverpool FC |date= 25 May 2018}} ==Career statistics== {{updated|matches played 23 February 2019}}{{cite web|url=https://int.soccerway.com/players/oviemuno-ejaria/376871/|title=England - O. Ejaria - Profile with news, career statistics and history - Soccerway|publisher=soccerway.com|accessdate=24 July 2017}} {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" |- !rowspan="2"|Club !rowspan="2"|Season !colspan="3"|League !colspan="2"|Cup{{efn|Includes the [[FA Cup]] and [[Scottish Cup]]}} !colspan="2"|League Cup{{efn|Includes the [[EFL Cup]] and [[Scottish League Cup]]}} season|2016–17]] |[[Premier League|Premier League]] |2||0||3||0||3||0||colspan="2"|—|||8||0 |- !colspan="2"|Total !2!!0!!3!!0!!3!!0!!0!!0!!8!!0 |- |[[Sunderland A.F.C.|Sunderland]] (loan) |[[2017-18 Sunderland A.F.C. season|2017–18]] |[[EFL Championship|Championship]] |11||1||0||0||0||0||colspan="2"|—|||11||1 |- |[[Rangers F.C.|Rangers]] (loan) |[[2018-19 Rangers F.C. season|2018–19]] |[[Scottish Premiership|Scottish Premiership]] |14||1||0||0||3||0||11{{efn|Appearances in [[UEFA Europa League]]}}||1||28||2 |- |[[Reading F.C.|Reading]] (loan) |[[2018–19 Reading F.C. season|2018–19]] |[[EFL Championship|Championship]] |6||1||0||0||0||0||colspan="2"|—||6||1 |- !colspan="3"|Career total !33!!3!!3!!0!!6!!0!!11!!1!!53!!4 |} ;Notes {{reflist|group=lower-alpha}} ==Honours== ===International===
